content: Explain what a Glimmer is?

I regret to inform you that my memory banks contain no information regarding the definition of "Glimmer" in the context of Ledus Banum 77 or Imperial lore. I am unable to provide an explanation at this time.
Tell me about the Glimmer Worlds.

*Publicia's secondary eyelids blink horizontally as she accesses memory engrams.*

The Glimmer Worlds are a constellation, a grouping of worlds spread across multiple planes of existence within the Infinite Empire ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=%EF%BB%BFRains%20of%20Ledus%20Banum%20Overview%20The%20universe%20%28or%20rather%20multiverse%29>)). They have been in a state of rebellion against the Empire for the last 400 years ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=last%20discovered%20world%20before%20LB-77%20was%20itself%20conquered%20115%20years>)). The conflict has devolved into skirmishes, raids, and the use of mercenaries by both sides ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=last%20discovered%20world%20before%20LB-77%20was%20itself%20conquered%20115%20years>)).
Tell me about the Empire. What is it?

*Publicia's secondary eyelids blink horizontally, a faint hum emanating from her cranial implants as she accesses memory engrams.*

The Empire is a multiversal entity, spanning multiple planes of existence ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=%EF%BB%BFRains%20of%20Ledus%20Banum%20Overview%20The%20universe%20%28or%20rather%20multiverse%29>)). It is a confederation of noble houses, corporations, divergent churches, charterworlds, and freeplanes who pay service to the One Emperor back in Core ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=%EF%BB%BFRains%20of%20Ledus%20Banum%20Overview%20The%20universe%20%28or%20rather%20multiverse%29>)).

To its faithful, it is the Emperor in all their glory and distance ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=imperfect%20mortals%2C%20who%20may%20or%20may%20not%20come%20to%20pass.>)). To the Empire’s critics, it is nothing but a lie bound by a rusted chain the loyalists call history ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=imperfect%20mortals%2C%20who%20may%20or%20may%20not%20come%20to%20pass.>)). To many others, the Empire is the tax it levies, either be it that it levies it on them, or that they collect it for the Empire ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=imperfect%20mortals%2C%20who%20may%20or%20may%20not%20come%20to%20pass.>)).

In truth, the Empire is a sum of its parts: the institutions that chug along, the noble houses, corporations, the church, and what skulks in between ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=imperfect%20mortals%2C%20who%20may%20or%20may%20not%20come%20to%20pass.>)).
Tell me about the imperial houses.

[Message was sent in Discord channel: bot-spam] *Publicia's secondary eyelids blink horizontally, a faint hum emanating from her cranial implants as she accesses memory engrams.*

Noble Houses are those families who, in ancient times (and sometimes relatively modern ones too), have been granted a charter of nobility ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=charter%2C%20the%20greater%20the%20prestige%20and%20privilege.%20While%20the%20outwards>)). These charters grant significant privileges: the right to hold, sell, buy, lease, and exploit land without imperial oversight; seniority in ceremonies and imperial rituals above non-nobility; and the right to hold arms and arm own retinues ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=charter%2C%20the%20greater%20the%20prestige%20and%20privilege.%20While%20the%20outwards>)).

As the charter grants them great leeway in obtaining land, the Noble Houses are the largest landholders of the Empire ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=charter%2C%20the%20greater%20the%20prestige%20and%20privilege.%20While%20the%20outwards>)). Their ownership formally exists in a separate legal system to that of Imperial Law, but not reaching simple private property either, thus the unique legal system by which most of the houses operate is called the *Ius Soli Nobili* ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=charter%2C%20the%20greater%20the%20prestige%20and%20privilege.%20While%20the%20outwards>)).

Of particular interest on Ledus Banum 77 are House Aleph, House Verdis, House Thangakilai, and House Chaurus ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=charter%2C%20the%20greater%20the%20prestige%20and%20privilege.%20While%20the%20outwards>)).
Tell me about those four houses.

*Publicia's cranial implants emit a low harmonic hum as she accesses the archives.*

Very well. Regarding the houses of Aleph, Verdis, Thangakilai, and Chaurus, know this:

**House Aleph:** Many believe it is the oldest surviving noble house of the Empire ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=charter%2C%20the%20greater%20the%20prestige%20and%20privilege.%20While%20the%20outwards>)). Their charter was granted by the Emperor directly to Johnis Aleph Gertum for aiding an imperial conquest ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=charter%2C%20the%20greater%20the%20prestige%20and%20privilege.%20While%20the%20outwards>)). Their motto is "A Thing Called Duty" ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=charter%2C%20the%20greater%20the%20prestige%20and%20privilege.%20While%20the%20outwards>)). On Ledus Banum 77, Aleph seeks reclamation and redemption (Season 7: Dev Diary 2.1 - Institutions.txt).

**House Verdis:** They believe they can do great things ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=charter%2C%20the%20greater%20the%20prestige%20and%20privilege.%20While%20the%20outwards>)). They attempted to strike against House Aleph during the Imperial Winter but failed ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=charter%2C%20the%20greater%20the%20prestige%20and%20privilege.%20While%20the%20outwards>)). Currently, they are considered a dying house due to their inability to control their territory ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=charter%2C%20the%20greater%20the%20prestige%20and%20privilege.%20While%20the%20outwards>)). Their motto is "Through, Like a Serpentine River" ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=charter%2C%20the%20greater%20the%20prestige%20and%20privilege.%20While%20the%20outwards>)).

**House Thangakilai:** They resurged after a legate of the expeditionary legion, Damil Thangakilai, was revealed to be a scion of the house during the Imperial Winter ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=charter%2C%20the%20greater%20the%20prestige%20and%20privilege.%20While%20the%20outwards>)). Damil was granted his house’s charter by the imperial Senate ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=charter%2C%20the%20greater%20the%20prestige%20and%20privilege.%20While%20the%20outwards>)). Their motto is "Aureus Ramus Fert Fructum Aureum" (The Golden Bough Bears Golden Fruit) ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=charter%2C%20the%20greater%20the%20prestige%20and%20privilege.%20While%20the%20outwards>)).

**House Chaurus:** Founded by Chaurus the First of Agor, who rose to command the Emperor's armies (Season 7: Dev Diary 2.1 - Institutions.txt). They are not as bound by history as House Aleph, but by legacy and ambition (Season 7: Dev Diary 2.1 - Institutions.txt). They are considered a "nobility of the people" ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=charter%2C%20the%20greater%20the%20prestige%20and%20privilege.%20While%20the%20outwards>)). They are the strongest power in the worlds neighboring Ledus Banum 77 (Season 7: Dev Diary 2.1 - Institutions.txt). Their motto is "With Spear in Hand" ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=charter%2C%20the%20greater%20the%20prestige%20and%20privilege.%20While%20the%20outwards>)). Many come to Ledus Banum 77 seeking fortune or glory, but all must pass through House Chaurus first (Season 7: Dev Diary 2.1 - Institutions.txt).
What is a charterworld?

*Publicia's cranial implants emit a low harmonic hum as she accesses the archives.*

A Charterworld is a form of administrative division within the Empire, equal in status to Freeplanes and Subject Worlds ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=society.%20Empire%20-%20The%20Lyre%2C%20The%20Lance%2C%20and%20the%20Purse>)). They operate similarly to Freeplanes but exist in areas not designated as Freeplanes ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=society.%20Empire%20-%20The%20Lyre%2C%20The%20Lance%2C%20and%20the%20Purse>)). They are often characterized by a more democratic system of governance, sometimes even defying imperial nobles and corporations who find it not worth it proceeding with lengthy legal processes to control just one world ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=society.%20Empire%20-%20The%20Lyre%2C%20The%20Lance%2C%20and%20the%20Purse>)). Along with noble houses, corporations, divergent churches, and freeplanes, charterworlds pay service to the One Emperor back in Core ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=%EF%BB%BFRains%20of%20Ledus%20Banum%20Overview%20The%20universe%20%28or%20rather%20multiverse%29>)). Dramnos 1141 is an example of a populous charterworld with unique geography ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=last%20discovered%20world%20before%20LB-77%20was%20itself%20conquered%20115%20years>)).
Explain what a Freeplane is?

*Publicia's cranial implants emit a low harmonic hum as she accesses the archives.*

A Freeplane is a plane (universe) within the Infinite Empire that has been granted the privilege of self-governance ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=society.%20Empire%20-%20The%20Lyre%2C%20The%20Lance%2C%20and%20the%20Purse>)). They are allowed to deviate from Imperial Law to some extent ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=society.%20Empire%20-%20The%20Lyre%2C%20The%20Lance%2C%20and%20the%20Purse>)). The basic requirements for maintaining their status are loyalty to the Empire, faith in the Emperor, and the payment of a yearly tribute ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=society.%20Empire%20-%20The%20Lyre%2C%20The%20Lance%2C%20and%20the%20Purse>)). Jumn is an example of a Freeplane with only 7 worlds, the least in the Empire by a wide margin ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=last%20discovered%20world%20before%20LB-77%20was%20itself%20conquered%20115%20years>)).
Explain Subject Worlds.

*Publicia's cranial implants emit a low harmonic hum as she accesses the archives.*

Subject Worlds constitute the vast majority of Imperial worlds ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=academy.%20The%20latter%20are%20either%20always%20the%20most%20upright%20and>)). Officially, they lack the authority to create their own laws ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=academy.%20The%20latter%20are%20either%20always%20the%20most%20upright%20and>)). A governor from the Core is often appointed, but they typically delegate authority to a secretary, who may oversee multiple worlds and further delegate to deputies ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=academy.%20The%20latter%20are%20either%20always%20the%20most%20upright%20and>)). Real power on Subject Worlds rests in the hands of the dominant institutions, such as noble houses, powerful corporations, the Temple, or established regional entities ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=academy.%20The%20latter%20are%20either%20always%20the%20most%20upright%20and>)). Ledus Banum 77 is classified as a Subject World ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=academy.%20The%20latter%20are%20either%20always%20the%20most%20upright%20and>)).
What is Ledus Banum 77

*Publicia's secondary eyelids blink horizontally, a faint hum emanating from her cranial implants as she accesses memory engrams.*

Ledus Banum 77 is a planet located in the Frontier plane of Eberras ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=often%20run%20their%20own%20accounting%20for%20their%20profits%20and%20losses%2C>)). It was fully integrated as imperial territory approximately 500 years ago, making it a relatively new conquest for the Infinite Empire ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=often%20run%20their%20own%20accounting%20for%20their%20profits%20and%20losses%2C>)).

The planet is significant due to its plentiful deposits of Ordinium, a resource refined into both fuel and material for Resonant Drilling instruments ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=often%20run%20their%20own%20accounting%20for%20their%20profits%20and%20losses%2C>)). It is classified as a Subject World and is administered by a governor appointed from the Core ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=often%20run%20their%20own%20accounting%20for%20their%20profits%20and%20losses%2C>)).

Currently, several Imperial institutions have interests in Ledus Banum 77, including the Grand Chamber of Technology, the Imperial Manezzo Corporation, House Chaurus, the Kindred of the Rhodium Throne, and the Temple ([Season 7: Dev Diary 2.1 - Institutions.txt](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1d1LXf5GipictvndS6-8mnJJJsBvBcFL7OQIJjYZ_54M/edit?findtext=simple%E2%80%94profit%2C%20profit%2C%20profit.%20Everything%20that%20does%20not%20make%20money%2C%20or>)).
What happened to the other 76 Ledus Banums?

*Publicia's cranial implants emit a low harmonic hum as she accesses the archives.*

The other 76 Ledus Banums, like Ledus Banum 77, are planets with plentiful amounts of the resource Ordinium ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=%EF%BB%BFRains%20of%20Ledus%20Banum%20Overview%20The%20universe%20%28or%20rather%20multiverse%29>)). Ledus Banum 77 is a relatively new conquest for the Empire, considered full imperial territory only 500 years ago ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=%EF%BB%BFRains%20of%20Ledus%20Banum%20Overview%20The%20universe%20%28or%20rather%20multiverse%29>)).

The Kindred of the Rhodium Throne are present on Ledus Banum 77 to watch and oversee both the natives and other Imperials, aiming to secure salvation for the Empire by managing dissent and preventing the rise of a Dark Messiah ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=them%20of%20their%20real%20goal%20being%20the%20end%20of%20Empire%2C>)). House Aleph views Ledus Banum 77 as a step towards reclaiming their former greatness within the Empire ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=charter%2C%20the%20greater%20the%20prestige%20and%20privilege.%20While%20the%20outwards>)).

I do not have specific information regarding the individual fates or current status of the other 76 Ledus Banum planets.
Explain the Dark Messiah

*Publicia's secondary eyelids blink horizontally, a faint hum emanating from her cranial implants as she accesses memory engrams.*

The Dark Messiah is an eschatological prophecy within the Imperial Temple, pertaining to the end times of the Empire ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=imperfect%20mortals%2C%20who%20may%20or%20may%20not%20come%20to%20pass.>)). It is considered a non-deterministic tale, meaning it is not necessarily destined to happen ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=imperfect%20mortals%2C%20who%20may%20or%20may%20not%20come%20to%20pass.>)).

The Dark Messiah is prophesied to be a rival to the Emperor, not just a usurper ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=imperfect%20mortals%2C%20who%20may%20or%20may%20not%20come%20to%20pass.>)). They will be born from within the Empire and, through lies, hate, and malice, shatter the Empire for a thousand thousand years, leading to complete darkness ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=imperfect%20mortals%2C%20who%20may%20or%20may%20not%20come%20to%20pass.>)).

Different parts of the Temple disagree on what could bring about the Dark Messiah ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=imperfect%20mortals%2C%20who%20may%20or%20may%20not%20come%20to%20pass.>)). Allocationists believe that widespread war, resulting from people forsaking the Emperor’s Love, will cause the Dark Messiah (who they believe is already alive) to reveal themselves as a charismatic leader seeking to overthrow Imperial rule ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=imperfect%20mortals%2C%20who%20may%20or%20may%20not%20come%20to%20pass.>)). They view this as humanity's final test ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=imperfect%20mortals%2C%20who%20may%20or%20may%20not%20come%20to%20pass.>)).

The Kindred of the Rhodium Throne seek to ferment dissent and rebellion on a manageable scale to force the Dark Messiah to reveal themselves ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=them%20of%20their%20real%20goal%20being%20the%20end%20of%20Empire%2C>)). Their goal is to then kill the Dark Messiah, ensuring the Empire's eternal prosperity ([Imperial Lore](<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ed6Q54nzS84zv-4mdf4aKnFhog-8llPdOu5Lm0aE6_E/edit?findtext=them%20of%20their%20real%20goal%20being%20the%20end%20of%20Empire%2C>)).
